report_title: KJET Busia County Application Ranking and Evaluation

S1_Registration_Track_Record_5%.reason: Registered >3 yrs, strong governance implied by detailed ownership structure.

S2_Financial_Position_20%.reason: Turnover KES 5M-<10M, stable/growing trend. Meets threshold.

S3_Market_Demand_Competitiveness_20%.reason: Active MOUs/Offtake mentioned, multi-channel sales, clear price/quality positioning.

S4_Business_Proposal_Viability_25%.reason: Clear problem–solution (training gap, clothing needs), detailed execution plan, quantified targets.

S5_Value_Chain_Alignment_10%.reason: Priority VC (Textiles), critical node (manufacturing/training), documented linkages.

S6_Inclusivity_Sustainability_20%.reason: High participation (50%+ youth, 40% women board), 2+ green practices (solar, organic sourcing, recycling).

applications.reason: The primary value chain is Solar Energy Services (Technology/Services) which is not one of the KJET Priority (Edible Oils, Dairy, Textiles, Construction) or Additional (Rice, Tea, Blue Economy, Minerals, Forestry, Leather) value chains.
The application claims KES 0 turnover/profit for all 3 years (2022-2024) and thus fails to provide verifiable financial evidence of operation.
The provided bank statement document is corrupted/unreadable (image-based or encrypted), failing to meet the minimum threshold for verifiable financial evidence.
The provided financial documents (Cashflow/Income Statements) are for 2016-2018, which is outside the required 'last 12 months' for verifiable financial evidence.
